derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English gycce (noun), gyccan (verb), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch jeuk (noun) and Dutch jeuken, German jucken (verb)

entry.def: When a part of your body itches, you have an unpleasant feeling on your skin that makes you want to scratch.

example.ex: When someone has hayfever, the eyes and nose will stream and itch...
example.tran: 花粉热临床表现为流泪、流涕，眼睛、鼻子发痒。

example.ex: My skin was hard and scaly and I itched.
example.tran: 我的皮肤又硬又粗糙,而且还很痒。

entry.def: If you are itching to do something, you are very eager or impatient to do it.

example.ex: I was itching to get involved and to bring my own theories into practice...
example.tran: 我渴望参与其中，把我的理论付诸实践。

example.ex: The general was itching for a fight.

means.word_mean: 1. a contagious skin infection caused by the itch mite; characterized by persistent itching and skin irritation;

sentences.sentence: "he has a bad case of the itch"

means.word_mean: 3. an irritating cutaneous sensation that produces a desire to scratch
1. scrape or rub as if to relieve itching;
3. have a strong desire or urge to do something;

sentences.sentence: "She is itching to start the project"

sentences.en: He had an itch on his back.

jushi.english: I've got an itch on the back of my neck.
